prompt:
You are provided with a list of characters, evidences and testimonies.
Characters:
Character 0
Name: Maya Fey
Description: My assistant and a disciple in the Kurain Tradition of spirit channeling.
Character 1
Name: Mia Fey
Description: Maya's older sister and my eternal mentor in life and law. Passed away 2 years ago. She was the attorney when Dahlia Hawthorne was sentenced to death. 
Character 2
Name: Godot
Description: A prosecutor who is shrouded in mystery. He seems to know me somehow.
Character 3
Name: Pearl Fey
Description: Maya's cousin, and channeling prodigy. She has amazingly powerful spiritual abilities.
Character 4
Name: Bikini
Description: A hearty, motherly nun at Hazakura Temple, a channeling dojo deep in the mountains.
Character 5
Name: Elise Deauxnim
Description: Kind-eyed author and illustrator of picture books. Pearls is huge fan of hers.
Character 6
Name: Iris
Description: A nun at Hazakura Temple. She reminds me so much of "her"...
Character 7
Name: Laurice Deauxnim* (when playing as Wright) → Larry Butz* (when playing as Edgeworth)
Description: Better known as Larry Butz. Current in training as Elise Deauxnim's pupil.
Character 8
Name: Phoenix Wright
Description: My friend since grade school. Fell from Dusky Bridge and is currently hospitalized.
Character 9
Name: Dick Gumshoe
Description: Homicide detective at the local precinct. In charge of the initial investigation.
Character 10
Name: Franziska von Karma
Description: My mentor, Manfred von Karma's, daughter. Born/raised in Germany. Prosecutor at 13.
Character 11
Name: Miles Edgeworth
Description: An old friend. Said to be #1 at the D.A.'s office. Studies foreign judicial systems now.
Character 12
Name: Morgan Fey
Description: Older sister of Misty Fey and mother of Pearl and Iris. Is in solitary confinement.
Character 13
Name: ?????? → Dahlia Hawthorne
Description: Morgan Fey's daughter and Iris's twin sister. Her father deals in jewelry apparently.
Evidences:
Evidence 0
Name: Attorney's Badge
Description: It's my all-important badge. It shows that I am a defense attorney.* (when playing as Wright) Received from Wright. He wasn't serious when he gave this to me... was he?* (when playing as Edgeworth)
Evidence 1
Name: Magatama
Description: A present from Maya. It reacts to people who have secrets in their hearts.* (when playing as Wright) Received from Wright. Something about reading people's hearts... What utter nonsense.* (when playing as Edgeworth)
Evidence 2
Name: Oh! Cult! New Year's Issue
Description: An occult magazine featuring Hazakura Temple. Click here for details.
Evidence 3
Name: Hazakura Temple Map
Description: Shows Hazakura Temple and the surrounding area. Click here for details.
Evidence 4
Name: Hanging Scroll
Description: Shows Misty Fey, Master of the Kurain Technique. Click here for details. Misty Fey's image is obscured by gravy. Godot described her as 'clad in her stunning Japanese garb surrounded by the hue and aroma of Western tastes'.
Evidence 5
Name: Photo of Elise
Description: Taken by her only pupil, Laurice Deauxnim. Click here for details.
Evidence 6
Name: Iris's Hood
Description: A magical hood said to offer protection from evil spirits. Received before the lights out bell the night of the crime. Protects from evil spirits.
Evidence 7
Name: Weather Data
Description: A regional weather report for the night of the crime.
Eagle Mountain Weather Data for Feb. 07
Snow, with occasional lightning strikes.

Snow: 7 to approx. 10:50 PM
Lightning: 10 to approx. 11 PM

Lightning struck Dusky Bridge at 10:45.
Around 30 minutes passed between
the fire starting and going out.
Evidence 8
Name: Note to Iris
Description: Found in the Main Hall. Maybe she dropped it? Click here for details.
Evidence 9
Name: Victim's Staff
Description: Carried by Elise Deauxnim when she was alive. Has her fingerprints on it. Has a sword hidden inside. No one knows this except Detective Gumshoe and I. Has a sword hidden inside. The actual weapon used to murder the victim.
Evidence 10
Name: Shichishito
Description: The apparent murder weapon. Had the victim's blood and the suspect's fingerprints on it. Had the victim's blood and the suspect's fingerprints on it, but is not the murder weapon.
Evidence 11
Name: Elise's Autopsy Report
Description: Time: 10 - 11 PM. Cause: loss of blood from stab in back. Body fell 10 ft. after death.
Evidence 12
Name: Iris's Testimony
Description: Rang lights out bell at 10 PM and was then in her room until the murder was discovered.
Evidence 13
Name: Crime Photo
Description: The courtyard where Elise Deauxnim was murdered. Click here for details.
Evidence 14
Name: Tracks Photo
Description: Taken that night. From Main Gate to Dusky Bridge. Click here for details.
Evidence 15
Name: Larry's Sketch
Description: Horrible sketch of what he saw the night of the crime. A bridge is on fire. There are two draw strings slanted above the bridge. A sihouette is seen gliding over the bridge. 
Evidence 16
Name: Crystal Sphere
Description: Found half-covered in snow near Dusky Bridge the night of the crime. Has blood on it. Found on outcropping near Dusky Bridge. Has blood on it. Came from the victim's staff.
Evidence 17
Name: Kurain Master's Talisman
Description: Worn by Elise Deauxnim. Found in the garden of the Inner Temple.
Evidence 18
Name: Burnt Letter
Description: Found by Gumshoe in the Inner Temple incinerator. Click here for details. Orders from Morgan Fey. Opened once before. Click here for details.
Evidence 19
Name: Dagger
Description: Found behind a tree in the Inner Temple garden. The blood is being analyzed now. Found stuck in a pine tree in Inner Temple Garden. The blood doesn't match the victim's.
Evidence 20
Name: Stone Lantern
Description: A lantern from the Inner Temple garden. Was not lit the night of the crime.
Evidence 21
Name: Dusky Bridge Photo
Description: Taken the morning after the crime. Click here for details.

Testimonies:
Testimony 0
Testimony: I went to the Inner Temple that night and I saw it all happen in the garden.
Person: Iris
Testimony 1
Testimony: I saw Mystic Elise strike Mystic Maya with her staff!
Person: Iris
Testimony 2
Testimony: While Mystic Maya was still stumbling, Mystic Elise moved in to deliver a fatal strike!
Person: Iris
Testimony 3
Testimony: She threw her staff away and pulled a dagger from inside her robe!
Person: Iris
Testimony 4
Testimony: Mystic Maya tried desperately to defend herself and stole the weapon...!
Person: Iris
Testimony 5
Testimony: It was only in self-defense! You can't blame her for it!
Person: Iris

Which evidence and testimony contradict each other? You must only answer one pair. You may output an explanation, but your answer must end with a JSON format like so: {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}. The answer JSON should strictly be the last line, followed by nothing else.
cot:
Okay, let's tackle this problem step by step. I need to find a pair of evidence and testimony that contradict each other. Let me start by going through each testimony and checking the evidence to see if there's a conflict.

First, the testimonies are from Iris. She claims that she saw Mystic Elise attack Mystic Maya in the Inner Temple garden. According to her, Elise used a staff and then a dagger hidden in her robe. The testimony mentions that Maya stole the weapon (the dagger) in self-defense.

Now, looking at the evidence. Evidence 19 is the Dagger, which was found stuck in a pine tree in the Inner Temple garden. The description says the blood on it doesn't match the victim's. If the dagger was used in the attack as Iris described, then the blood should be the victim's (Mystic Maya's), but the evidence states it doesn't match. That's a possible contradiction.

Wait, but the victim here might be Elise Deauxnim, since the case is about her murder. Wait, the problem says Elise was murdered, so the victim in the case is Elise. But in Iris's testimony, she's talking about Mystic Elise attacking Mystic Maya, implying Maya is the attacker and Elise is the victim? Wait, that's confusing. Let me check the characters again.

Looking at Character 1 (Mia Fey), she's the one who was the attorney when Dahlia was sentenced. But the current victim is Elise Deauxnim. The testimonies from Iris are about Mystic Elise (maybe Elise Deauxnim?) attacking Mystic Maya (Mia Fey?), but Mia is deceased. Hmm, maybe there's confusion here.

Wait, the testimonies say Mystic Elise struck Mystic Maya. If the case is about Elise's murder, then the testimony's scenario would have Elise as the attacker and Maya as the victim, but the actual victim here is Elise. So perhaps the testimony is incorrect in the sequence of events.

Alternatively, maybe the dagger found (Evidence 19) is supposed to be the murder weapon, but according to the evidence 9, the victim's staff contains the actual weapon. The dagger's blood not matching the victim (Elise) might mean it wasn't used on her. But according to Iris, Elise used the dagger on Maya, so if Maya is the attacker, but that's conflicting with the main case's victim.

Alternatively, the testimony says Elise used the staff and then a dagger. The staff (Evidence 9) is the actual murder weapon. The dagger (Evidence 19) is separate. But if the dagger's blood doesn't match Elise, then it wasn't used to kill her. So if Iris claims that Elise used the dagger to attack Maya, but the dagger's blood isn't Elise's, maybe that's a contradiction. Wait, but if Elise was the one stabbed, then the dagger's blood would be Maya's (if Maya used it on Elise). But the blood on the dagger doesn't match the victim (Elise), which would make sense if it's Maya's blood. But the testimony says Elise used the dagger on Maya, so the dagger's blood should be Maya's, which is allowed because the victim here is Elise. Hmm, maybe this isn't the contradiction.

Looking at another angle: Evidence 12 is Iris's testimony, where she claims she was in her room after ringing the lights out bell at 10 PM until the murder was discovered. But if the murder happened later, but according to Testimony 0 from Iris, she went to the Inner Temple and witnessed the attack there. If the time she was supposed to be in her room conflicts with her being at the Inner Temple garden, that's a contradiction. But the testimonies are all from Iris, so maybe the evidence that contradicts is her own testimony. Wait, but the question is between evidence and testimony. Evidence 12 is her testimony, so can't contradict itself.

Alternatively, Evidence 15 is Larry's Sketch, which shows the bridge on fire and a silhouette gliding over. If the testimony claims the murder happened in the garden, but the sketch shows the bridge on fire, maybe the time or location conflicts. But the murder location is the courtyard (Evidence 13), so maybe that's separate.

Wait, looking at Evidence 9: the victim's staff has a hidden sword which is the actual murder weapon. The testimony mentions Elise using a staff and then a dagger. If the murder was done with the sword hidden in the staff, then the dagger (Evidence 19) wasn't the murder weapon, which aligns with the testimony's claim that the dagger was used but maybe not the fatal one. But the testimony says Elise used the staff first, then the dagger. If the staff's hidden sword was the actual weapon, then the dagger wasn't the murder weapon. But the testimony's scenario might have the dagger as the weapon, which would contradict Evidence 9's statement that the staff's sword is the actual weapon.

Wait, the testimony says Elise used the staff to strike Maya, then pulled a dagger to deliver a fatal strike. So the fatal weapon would be the dagger. But Evidence 9 says the staff's hidden sword is the actual murder weapon. Therefore, if the dagger wasn't used to kill, then the testimony's claim that the fatal strike was with the dagger contradicts Evidence 9. That's a contradiction.

So the contradiction would be between Testimony 3 (claiming the dagger was used for the fatal strike) and Evidence 9 (the staff's sword is the murder weapon). Therefore, the pair is evidence 9 and testimony 3.

Wait, but let me confirm. The testimony's Testimony 3 says: "She threw her staff away and pulled a dagger from inside her robe!" implying the dagger was used to kill. But Evidence 9 says the staff's hidden sword is the actual murder weapon. So that's a direct contradiction: the testimony says the dagger was the weapon, evidence says the staff's sword was. So the answer would be {"evidence":9, "testimony":3}.
</think>

cot:
Okay, let's tackle this problem step by step. I need to find a pair of evidence and testimony that contradict each other. Let's start by going through each testimony and checking the evidence to see if there's a conflict.

First, looking at the testimonies from Iris (Character 6). Her testimony claims that Mystic Elise was stabbed by Mystic Maya using a dagger. Specifically, in Testimony 4, she mentions that Mystic Elise was stabbed and the dagger was involved. 

Now, looking at the evidences, Evidence 19 is the Dagger. The description says it was found in the Inner Temple garden with blood that doesn't match the victim's (Elise's). The key point here is that the blood on the dagger doesn't belong to Elise. If Iris's testimony says that Maya used the dagger to stab Elise, but the dagger's blood isn't Elise's, that would mean the dagger wasn't the murder weapon. However, the autopsy report (Evidence 11) states that Elise died from a stab wound in the back. 

Wait, but the actual murder weapon according to Evidence 9 (Victim's Staff) is the staff that hides a sword. The Shichishito (Evidence 10) has the victim's blood but isn't the real weapon. So if the dagger's blood isn't Elise's, then it couldn't have caused her death. Therefore, if Iris says Maya used the dagger to stab Elise, that contradicts the evidence because the dagger's blood isn't Elise's, meaning it wasn't the murder weapon. The real weapon was the staff's hidden sword. 

Another point: Testimony 3 says Mystic Maya stabbed Elise, but the autopsy says Elise was stabbed in the back. If the dagger wasn't the weapon, then the actual weapon was the staff's sword. Therefore, Iris's testimony about the dagger being used contradicts Evidence 19, which states the dagger's blood doesn't match Elise's. 

Alternatively, looking at Testimony 2 mentions the stone lantern being lit. But Evidence 20 says the Stone Lantern wasn't lit that night. That's another contradiction. Wait, Testimony 2 says "with her back to the stone lantern." The testimony doesn't say the lantern was lit, just that Elise was near it. The evidence says it wasn't lit, but the testimony doesn't claim it was lit, just location. So that might not be a contradiction.

Back to the dagger. Since the testimony says the dagger was used in the fatal stab, but the dagger's blood isn't the victim's, that's a contradiction. The correct pair would be Evidence 19 and Testimony 3 or 4. Let me check the exact testimony numbers again.

Testimony 4: "Mystic Elise managed to fling the knife away, but then... Then... she collapsed." So the dagger was flung away, but the actual killing weapon was the staff's sword. Therefore, the dagger wasn't the murder weapon, which is supported by Evidence 19. But the testimony claims the dagger was used in the stabbing, which contradicts the evidence that the dagger's blood isn't Elise's. 

Therefore, the contradiction is between Testimony 3 (claiming the dagger was used to stab Elise) and Evidence 19 (dagger's blood doesn't match). So the correct pair would be evidence 19 and testimony 3.
</think>

cot:
Okay, let's tackle this problem step by step. I need to find a pair of evidence and testimony that contradict each other. Let me start by going through each piece of evidence and testimony to see where there might be inconsistencies.

First, looking at the testimonies provided by Iris (Character 6). The testimonies are numbered 0 to 6. Let me go through each one and see what they say.

Testimony 0: Iris says she called out to Maya after Elise died, thinking it was her duty to protect Maya as the future Master. Then she moved the body from the Inner Temple across Dusky Bridge using a snowmobile and altered the wound with the Shichishito. She mentions that by the time the murder took place, the snow had stopped.

Wait, the key points here are the timeline and the actions. Let's check the evidence related to weather and time. Evidence 7 is the Weather Data, which states that snow stopped around 10:50 PM, and lightning was from 10 to 11 PM. The autopsy report (Evidence 11) says the time of death was between 10-11 PM, with the body falling after death. 

Testimony 6 says that "by the time the murder took place, the snow had already stopped." The murder time is 10-11 PM, and according to the weather data, snow stopped at around 10:50 PM. If the murder was happening up until 11 PM, then the snow would have stopped before the murder was completed? Wait, maybe there's a timeline issue here. The testimony claims that when the murder took place, the snow had already stopped. But according to the weather data, snow was until ~10:50 PM. So if the murder was happening between 10-11 PM, then during the murder, it might still have been snowing until 10:50. prompt:
You are provided with a list of characters, evidences and testimonies.
Characters:
Character 0
Name: Maya Fey
Description: My assistant and a disciple in the Kurain Tradition of spirit channeling.
Character 1
Name: Mia Fey
Description: Maya's older sister and my eternal mentor in life and law. Passed away 2 years ago. She was the attorney when Dahlia Hawthorne was sentenced to death. 
Character 2
Name: Godot
Description: A prosecutor who is shrouded in mystery. He seems to know me somehow.
Character 3
Name: Pearl Fey
Description: Maya's cousin, and channeling prodigy. She has amazingly powerful spiritual abilities.
Character 4
Name: Bikini
Description: A hearty, motherly nun at Hazakura Temple, a channeling dojo deep in the mountains.
Character 5
Name: Elise Deauxnim
Description: Kind-eyed author and illustrator of picture books. Pearls is huge fan of hers.
Character 6
Name: Iris
Description: A nun at Hazakura Temple. She reminds me so much of "her"...
Character 7
Name: Laurice Deauxnim* (when playing as Wright) → Larry Butz* (when playing as Edgeworth)
Description: Better known as Larry Butz. Current in training as Elise Deauxnim's pupil.
Character 8
Name: Phoenix Wright
Description: My friend since grade school. Fell from Dusky Bridge and is currently hospitalized.
Character 9
Name: Dick Gumshoe
Description: Homicide detective at the local precinct. In charge of the initial investigation.
Character 10
Name: Franziska von Karma
Description: My mentor, Manfred von Karma's, daughter. Born/raised in Germany. Prosecutor at 13.
Character 11
Name: Miles Edgeworth
Description: An old friend. Said to be #1 at the D.A.'s office. Studies foreign judicial systems now.
Character 12
Name: Morgan Fey
Description: Older sister of Misty Fey and mother of Pearl and Iris. Is in solitary confinement.
Character 13
Name: ?????? → Dahlia Hawthorne
Description: Morgan Fey's daughter and Iris's twin sister. Her father deals in jewelry apparently.
Evidences:
Evidence 0
Name: Attorney's Badge
Description: It's my all-important badge. It shows that I am a defense attorney.* (when playing as Wright) Received from Wright. He wasn't serious when he gave this to me... was he?* (when playing as Edgeworth)
Evidence 1
Name: Magatama
Description: A present from Maya. It reacts to people who have secrets in their hearts.* (when playing as Wright) Received from Wright. Something about reading people's hearts... What utter nonsense.* (when playing as Edgeworth)
Evidence 2
Name: Oh! Cult! New Year's Issue
Description: An occult magazine featuring Hazakura Temple. Click here for details.
Evidence 3
Name: Hazakura Temple Map
Description: Shows Hazakura Temple and the surrounding area. Click here for details.
Evidence 4
Name: Hanging Scroll
Description: Shows Misty Fey, Master of the Kurain Technique. Click here for details. Misty Fey's image is obscured by gravy. Godot described her as 'clad in her stunning Japanese garb surrounded by the hue and aroma of Western tastes'.
Evidence 5
Name: Photo of Elise
Description: Taken by her only pupil, Laurice Deauxnim. Click here for details.
Evidence 6
Name: Iris's Hood
Description: A magical hood said to offer protection from evil spirits. Received before the lights out bell the night of the crime. Protects from evil spirits.
Evidence 7
Name: Weather Data
Description: A regional weather report for the night of the crime.
Eagle Mountain Weather Data for Feb. 07
Snow, with occasional lightning strikes.

Snow: 7 to approx. 10:50 PM
Lightning: 10 to approx. 11 PM

Lightning struck Dusky Bridge at 10:45.
Around 30 minutes passed between
the fire starting and going out.
Evidence 8
Name: Note to Iris
Description: Found in the Main Hall. Maybe she dropped it? Click here for details.
Evidence 9
Name: Victim's Staff
Description: Carried by Elise Deauxnim when she was alive. Has her fingerprints on it. Has a sword hidden inside. No one knows this except Detective Gumshoe and I. Has a sword hidden inside. The actual weapon used to murder the victim.
Evidence 10
Name: Shichishito
Description: The apparent murder weapon. Had the victim's blood and the suspect's fingerprints on it. Had the victim's blood and the suspect's fingerprints on it, but is not the murder weapon.
Evidence 11
Name: Elise's Autopsy Report
Description: Time: 10 - 11 PM. Cause: loss of blood from stab in back. Body fell 10 ft. after death.
Evidence 12
Name: Iris's Testimony
Description: Rang lights out bell at 10 PM and was then in her room until the murder was discovered.
Evidence 13
Name: Crime Photo
Description: The courtyard where Elise Deauxnim was murdered. Click here for details.
Evidence 14
Name: Tracks Photo
Description: Taken that night. From Main Gate to Dusky Bridge. Click here for details.
Evidence 15
Name: Larry's Sketch
Description: Horrible sketch of what he saw the night of the crime. A bridge is on fire. There are two draw strings slanted above the bridge. A sihouette is seen gliding over the bridge. 
Evidence 16
Name: Crystal Sphere
Description: Found half-covered in snow near Dusky Bridge the night of the crime. Has blood on it. Found on outcropping near Dusky Bridge. Has blood on it. Came from the victim's staff.
Evidence 17
Name: Kurain Master's Talisman
Description: Worn by Elise Deauxnim. Found in the garden of the Inner Temple.
Evidence 18
Name: Burnt Letter
Description: Found by Gumshoe in the Inner Temple incinerator. Click here for details. Orders from Morgan Fey. Opened once before. Click here for details.
Evidence 19
Name: Dagger
Description: Found behind a tree in the Inner Temple garden. The blood is being analyzed now. Found stuck in a pine tree in Inner Temple Garden. The blood doesn't match the victim's.
Evidence 20
Name: Stone Lantern
Description: A lantern from the Inner Temple garden. Was not lit the night of the crime.
Evidence 21
Name: Dusky Bridge Photo
Description: Taken the morning after the crime. Click here for details.

Testimonies:
Testimony 0
Testimony: I was passing through the garden on the way to a spare prep room when it happened.
Person: Maya
Testimony 1
Testimony: Suddenly, someone struck me over the head...
Person: Maya
Testimony 2
Testimony: I stumbled... and ended up against the stone lantern.
Person: Maya
Testimony 3
Testimony: I think I screamed, "Help me!"
Person: Maya
Testimony 4
Testimony: I could see a man behind my attacker by the light of the stone lantern.
Person: Maya
Testimony 5
Testimony: Then something warm splashed over me...
Person: Maya
Testimony 6
Testimony: That's when... I lost consciousness.
Person: Maya

Which evidence and testimony contradict each other? You must only answer one pair. You may output an explanation, but your answer must end with a JSON format like so: {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}. The answer JSON should strictly be the last line, followed by nothing else.
cot:
Okay, let me try to work through this step by step. The user provided a list of characters, evidence, and testimonies, and they want to find a pair that contradicts each other. I need to look for an inconsistency between one piece of evidence and one testimony.

First, I'll go through the testimonies given by Maya. Her testimony mentions that she was in the garden, stumbled against the stone lantern, saw a man behind her attacker by the light of the stone lantern, and then lost consciousness. 

Now, looking at the evidence, especially Evidence 20: the Stone Lantern's description says it was not lit the night of the crime. If the lantern wasn't lit, Maya couldn't have seen anything by its light. That directly contradicts her testimony where she mentions seeing a man because of the lantern's light. 

So, the contradiction is between Testimony 4 (Maya saying she saw a man by the lantern's light) and Evidence 20 (the lantern wasn't lit). Therefore, the correct pair should be Evidence 20 and Testimony 4.
</think>

cot:
Okay, let's tackle this problem step by step. The user provided a list of characters, evidences, and testimonies, and I need to find a pair of evidence and testimony that contradict each other. The answer should be in JSON format with the evidence number and testimony number.

First, I'll start by reviewing all the testimonies and evidences to identify any contradictions. Let's go through each testimony and see which evidence might conflict with it.

Looking at the current testimonies from Maya (Testimony 0 to 5):

Testimony 0: Maya mentions waking up on the Training Hall floor. Not sure how this connects yet.

Testimony 1: She says when she returned to the garden, things had changed. Maybe related to evidence about the crime scene?

Testimony 2: She thinks the killer cleaned up evidence for her sake. Maybe related to evidence about the crime scene being altered?

Testimony 3: The torches were lit, and the body was gone. Wait, but the Stone Lantern (Evidence 20) says it was not lit that night. If Maya says torches (which might refer to the stone lantern) were lit, that's a conflict.

Testimony 4: Snow around the stone lantern was cleaned up. But if the lantern wasn't lit, maybe the cleaning contradicts something?

Testimony 5: Assumes it was a man because of the cleanup. Not sure about contradiction here yet.

Looking at Evidence 20: Stone Lantern was not lit the night of the crime. 

In Testimony 3, Maya says "the torches were lit..." If "torches" refers to the stone lantern, then Testimony 3 directly contradicts Evidence 20. The testimony claims the lantern was lit, while the evidence says it wasn't.

Alternatively, maybe "torches" refers to other lights, but given that Evidence 20 specifically mentions the Stone Lantern not being lit, and Testimony 3 mentions the stone lantern's area being cleaned, it's likely the lantern itself. 

Another possible contradiction: Testimony 4 mentions snow cleaned around the stone lantern. But if the lantern wasn't lit, maybe the cleanup would be inconsistent with that? Not sure, but the main conflict seems to be Testimony 3 stating the lantern was lit versus Evidence 20 stating it wasn't.

So the contradiction is between Evidence 20 and Testimony 3. Therefore, the answer should be {"evidence": 20, "testimony": 3}.
</think>
